dbp:notableWorks: 'Velicham Kooduthal Velicham' , 'Rajeev Gandhi : Surya Thejassinte Ormakku' 'Mandelayude Nattil; Gandhijiyudeyum' . 'K Damodaran Muthal Berlin Kunjananthan Nair Vare'

text: Thalekunnil Basheer is one of the senior politicians in the state of Kerala, India. He was a member of Kerala Legislative Assembly. He was member of parliament (both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha). He was also an office bearer of the Kerala Pradesh congress committee. He is the author of many books. His writings include 'Velicham Kooduthal Velicham' ( Collection of Articles), 'Rajeev Gandhi : Surya Thejassinte Ormakku', 'Mandelayude Nattil; Gandhijiyudeyum' (Travelogue). K Damodaran muthal Berlin Kunjananthan Nair vare'. He served as president DCC trivandrum, KPCC general secretary, KPCC vice -president, KPCC president (acting) and chairman TRIDA. He is a columnist with several newspapers. The evergreen Malayalam actor (late)Mr.Prem Nazir. was his Brother in law.

dbp:notableWorks: Commenced "Clean up the Lake" which led to discussions with Ian Kiernan who subsequently developed Clean up Australia

text: Ivan Joseph Welsh (25 February 1940 – 15 March 2007) was an Australian politician. Born in Newcastle, Welsh attended Newcastle Boys' High School from 1952 to 1955 and served in the army from 1958 to 1967, including periods in Malaya (1958–60) and Vietnam (1965–66) as a Linguist and Intelligence officer. In 1961, he married Lorraine Gay Cox. After his military service concluded, he became a restaurateur, caterer and salesman, and in 1984 was elected to Lake Macquarie City Council, becoming mayor in 1987. In 1988, he was elected to the New South Wales Legislative Assembly as an Independent, representing the seat of Swansea. He held the seat until his defeat by the Labor candidate in 1991, in which year he also lost the mayoralty. He continued to contest both state and federal elections, both as an Independent and (in 1996) as a member of the Liberal Party. Welsh died at Newcastle in 2007, and was cremated.

Sayyed As'ad Madani (April 27, 1928 AD-February 6, 2006 AD) (Urdu: سید اسعد مدنے ) was an Indian Deobandi Islamic scholar and politician. He was the President of Jamiat Ulema-e-Hind and a prominent member of executive body (Majlis-e-Shura) of Darul Uloom Deoband.
